title: Walter Gropius
summary: Walter Adolph Georg Gropius (18 May 1883 â€“ 5 July 1969) was a German architect and founder of the Bauhaus School,[1] who, along with Alvar Aalto, Ludwig Mies van der Rohe, Le Corbusier and Frank Lloyd Wright, is widely regarded as one of the pioneering masters of modernist architecture. He is a founder of Bauhaus in Weimar (1919).[2]  Gropius was also a leading architect of the International Style.[3]
